    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addParty

        public static void addParty(Restaurant restaurant)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Helper method to add a party to the restaurant. Input includes a customer name, the size of the party, and whether they are a pet or no pet party. A party will be invalid if a party with the same name is in the restaurant already.
        Parameters:
        restaurant - The Restaurant object that will have a party added to it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an issue reading in from the user

      • seatParty

        public static void seatParty(Restaurant restaurant)
        Helper method to seat a party already within the restaurant. Used to call the seatParty method of the Restaurant object. The program will attempt to find a table for any customer starting with the customers that arrived first.
        Parameters:
        restaurant - The Restaurant object where a party will be seated.

      • partyLeaves

        public static void partyLeaves(Restaurant restaurant)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Allows a party to leave their table. Reads in a party name from the user. Used to call the partyExits method of the restaurant class. If the info received from partyExits is null then the party is said to not be seated.
        Parameters:
        restaurant - The Restaurant object where a party will attempt to leave.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an issue reading in from the user

      • addTable

        public static void addTable(Restaurant restaurant)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Overloaded addTable method allows the user to decide if the table has pets or not. This method calls the other addTable with a boolean representing the table's pet preference.
        Parameters:
        restaurant - The Restaurant object that will be passed to the other addTable mathod.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an issue reading in from the user

      • addTable

        public static void addTable(Restaurant restaurant,
                            boolean pet)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a table to the restaurant. Reads in a table name from the user and calls tableNameFree to determine the validity of the name. If valid, the size of the table is then input and the restaurant object's method addTable is called.
        Parameters:
        restaurant - The Restaurant object that has a table added.
        pet - boolean, true for pet table, false for no pet
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an issue reading in from the user

      • removeTable

        public static void removeTable(Restaurant restaurant)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Removes a table from the restaurant if it is not currently in use. Reads in which section the user wishes to remove a table from and then reads in the table name to be removed. If the table does not exist, or is in a different section, then a message saying the table does not exist is printed. If the table is in use this is output and the table is not removed. Otherwise the table is removed from its section.
        Parameters:
        restaurant - The Restaurant object that will have a table removed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an issue reading in from the user

      • displayAvailableTables

        public static void displayAvailableTables(Restaurant restaurant)
        Method to print out the table that do not have a party.
        Parameters:
        restaurant - The Restaurant whose table details will be printed out.

      • displayPartyWait

        public static void displayPartyWait(Restaurant restaurant)
        Method to print out the details of the parties currently not seated. First the pet parties details will be printed, then the no pet party details will be printed.
        Parameters:
        restaurant - The Restaurant whose party details will be printed out.

      • displayPartyServed

        public static void displayPartyServed(Restaurant restaurant)
        Method to print out the information of the current tables in use and the parties at the tables.
        Parameters:
        restaurant - The Restaurant whose in use table details will be printed out.
